history.content:
If you take p then the gpa does not change. If you take letter grade then the gpa will not count D if you have no more 3 retake classes but the transcript shows D.

If you take P, the previous D will be removed from your GPA.

Source: https://ls.berkeley.edu/spring-2020-policy-updates-and-faqs
If you take p then the gpa does not change. If you take letter grade then the gpa will not count D if you have no more 3 retake classes but the transcript shows D.

Hi, I took ee16a last semester and got D. And I am retaking ee16a this semester. I am just curious what if I take p for this class, how does gpa work? Also, if choose letter grade for this class, will this semester’s grade replace last semester’s D? And don’t take consider D in my gpa? Thank you!
history.subject: retake class with pnp
